Material used.Description: COS-7 cells were transiently transfected with wild-type or G309D c-Myc–tagged PINK1 cDNA constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: The mutation did not alter production of mature full-length protein, suggesting it does not significantly affect protein stability.
The mutation did not alter production of mature full-length protein, suggesting it does not significantly affect protein stability.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in three independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was performed in duplicate or triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type c-Myc–tagged PINK1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were transiently cotransfected with wild-type and mutant PINK1 cDNA and a green fluorescent protein (GFP) reporter plasmid.

Readout description.Result Description: After stress with MG-132, there was a significant decrease in mitochondrial membrane potential in cells transfected with G309D PINK1 as compared with wild-type PINK1 (G309D, –44.1% ± 8.1; versus wild-type PINK1, 13.0% ± 13.7; P < 0.01).

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in three independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was performed in duplicate or triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type c-Myc–tagged PINK1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were transiently cotransfected with wild-type and mutant PINK1 cDNA and a green fluorescent protein (GFP) reporter plasmid.

Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of wild-type PINK1 but not mutant PINK1 significantly reduced the level of apoptotic cell death induced by MG-132 in GFP-positive cells (vector, 45.4% ± 5.0; wild-type PINK1, 32.7% ± 4.0; G309D, 45.8% ± 5.0; P < 0.05).

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in four independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was performed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type c-Myc–tagged PINK1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.
